name: HD 136418
scenarioDescription:
The HD 136418 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 136418 is a star with 1.48 times the mass of the Sun, and 3.78 times its radius. It is located 344.06 light years away from the solar system.

HD 136418 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 136418 system


HD 136418 b

HD 136418 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.29 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 136418 b is 680.5200000000001 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 136418 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 136418, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by W. M. Keck Observatory.
